@jainmehul
First of all, thanks for this.
Secondly I just wanted to point out that the comments the people were making on the quality of the sound don't necessarily have anything to do with the rip of the cd to mp3. They were saying that the sound clipped which basically means that during the recording the soundlevel exceeded the allowed volume for the recording equipment leading to the loudest parts simply being cut off. (assuming digital recording equipment was used) It could also be faulty mastering which is the last stage in the recording process but this is less likely. Then there's the possibility that the mp3 encoding software fucked up by raising the volume levels up too high leading to digital distortion.
I'm listening to some songs now and I can hear distortion but I'm using crappy laptop speakers and it's late. I'll have to wait till I get a chance to listen to it in my car to make a proper judgement. Also I should check out a different rip of the cd to see if there are any differences in the sound.
But ofcourse Beastie Boys do have a certain sound and perhaps they used distortion on purpose to make their tracks sound less tight.

I've sampled another rip of this and it also has the distortion which means it was already there on the cd. My guess is they distorted it on purpose during recording to make it sound cool. So there's absolutely nothing wrong with this torrent peeps.

The distortion that everyone talks about its perfectly normal, they did on purpose to sound like the old school days.. but..if you want to change that a little, I've tried change the 41000 Hz up to 48000Hz made a difference but after all you can't remove something that is supposed to be there..Even at the studio with all the tools its impossible to remove it. Beastie Boys the "new" old school, love it or hate it..there's nothing you can do about it..

By the way the track used for test was "too many rappers" since is the one with more (original) significant distortion added due the use of bass's, kicks, claps..

This a 100% secure rip! Enjoy it!

In the years of vinyl, we knew easily now...not so much.  THe BB must be using the same shithead to master their CD, in the end that will likely be their undoing.
